thread.title: Thibaut Courtois has been blasted by broadcasters after skipping a TV interview – due to a stomach bug
thread.title_full: Thibaut Courtois has been blasted by broadcasters after skipping a TV interview – due to a stomach bug

author: jgordon
title: Thibaut Courtois has been blasted by broadcasters after skipping a TV interview – due to a stomach bug
text:
Courtois is fighting to be fit for the clash against in-form Swansea this weekend Reuters 3 Pedro wheels away after scoring the opening goal for as Chelsea beat Wolves 2-0 
Telefoot presenters Christian Jeanpierre and Frederic Calenge fumed: “All we can say is that to let us know like that at the very last minute is not very ‘Courtois’.” 
Station editor-in-chief Marc Ambrosiano tweeted: “Unfortunately Thibaut Courtois is suffering from gastroenteritis, and has had to withdraw from appearing on Telefoot this morning. Related Stories CAN'T CONSOLE HIM Chelsea's Michy Batshuayi looks distraught after fluffing Fifa 17 skills challenge ...while team-mate Kurt Zouma absolutely nails it 'Brady on fire' Thibaut Courtois trolled for 'predicting' Robbie Brady's brilliant free kick with Super Bowl tweet praising Burnley star's namesake More than a Goal Robbie Brady's free-kick for Burnley ends Thibaut Courtois' incredible league record with Chelsea key to it all Keylor Navas offered to Juventus, Lazio and Roma as Real Madrid make space for Courtois or De Gea GLOVES ARE OFF David de Gea and Thibaut Courtois in battle to replace Keylor Navas as Real Madrid No1 Not Donn and dusted Real Madrid to turn to Gianluigi Donnarumma if they can't get Thibaut Courtois or David De Gea extreme courting Thibaut Courtois' agent 'is ringing Real Madrid EVERY DAY to try and sort a summer switch' 
“We wish him a speedy recovery.” 
Chelsea boss Antonio Conte now hopes Courtois will be fit in time for the Premier League leaders’ clash with a resurgent Swansea side at Stamford Bridge on Saturday. Wolves 0-2 Chelsea : Chelsea cruise through to the quarter finals
